title: Champion help! Would love for advice!!(:
body:
Since my first attempt at advice on here went so amazing I am asking for it yet again! I am a new girl looking to get better at league! I got such great game advice that i now want to practice what i learned! However i just realized I dont have a champ to practice with! I have tons of IP and RP because my fiancee wants me to get anything i need! I would love some advice and thoughts on **who to buy!**!! My preferences are below but im open to ideas outside what i put!!! **Thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! **



**My ideas on who i think i would play best as:** (keep in mind i am only level 7 so i need a champion who is not extremely difficult to learn the strategy if possible)

* I think i prefer a ranged champ that way i can hang back and turret hug a little while still doing damage. I don't know how well i would do with a tank because im nervous about diving into the heat of the battle!
* I like mid because it allows me some solo time to not worry about jacking kills or screwing someone on my team over. I have played annie and i like her but i want to try something new. I also like that Mid is usually ranged mages. ( i dont know if mage is the right word)
* I like bot adc because i really really like playing high damage champs. Also they tend to be not to malee
* I dont really want to do support because it seems really confusing. I would hate to accidentally steal a cs, kill, or to not support correctly and have my adc die.
* I really like high damge champs
* I like how an assasin sounds 
* I dont know how to jungle at all



Again thank you!!!!!!!!!!

replies.body:

Hate to burst your bubble, but 3/4 of those suggestions are in an underpowered state ever since the mana regen nerfs (Zyra is the only one who came out of it relatively unscathed). I've been trying to ask Meddler about it for weeks now, but he keeps ignoring my topics.

If you were to ask anyone else, they'd suggest {{champion:101}} because he simply outclasses every other long-range mana mage right now.

Sorry if this sounds a bit rude, but I'm just a little jaded since Meddler and the balance team seem to be ignoring my Lux's plight. Can you see if they'll actually talk about giving the mages you mentioned some TLC?

i don't think 'underpowered states' matter much for a level 7 player; when i first started playing i only ever played {{champion:82}} (who is NEVER FotM), and rolled face and had fun since i knew the champ. if she wants to play lux or MF or syndra, great! those are great champs to learn the game and the AP mage (or in MF's case, AD Carry) roles

I was more trying to ask RiotNurseFlan for her help in speaking to Meddler about the mana mages.

Turns out that's punished...

Hi, 

I'm not very high in rank, but I've been playing since season 2 and study the game well. If you want someone to play with in game add me (Symphonic Death) and My lower account Kid Tulu. 

I do agree with NurseFlan, I'd also throw in 

{{champion:63}} Brand (AP Mid)
{{champion:51}} Caitlyn (AD Bot)
{{champion:21}} Miss Fortune (AD Bot)
Long range mage? Doesn't get longer than Xerath. Personally I never play him, you have to move the screen too much but maybe you'll like him

Yep, Xerath outclasses all of the other long-range mages right now because his damage-per-mana-spent ratios are simply superior. Additionally, his passive means that he never suffers mana issues in lane, unlike Ziggs, Lux, etc.

My thoughts for ranged/poke style champs:

{{champion:143}} Zyra
{{champion:30}}  Karthus
{{champion:69}} Cassiopeia

{{champion:63}}  mid

also for any champion you want to try go to lolking.net and look at the champion builds and people will give you tips on how to use them

if you like safe and high damage then {{champion:115}}ziggs and  {{champion:103}} ahri are probably your best choices.  

they're both very reliant on skill shots which means they can be a little difficult to learn, but they're both *really* fun to play when you get good with them. they also both have enough mobility and range to keep safe in fights while still dishing out their damage.

Not direct advice, but if you like how assasssin sounds you need to be prepared for a completely different playstyle than long range and safe. Just a warning in advance, personally I play alot of asssassins and love the playstyel

{{champion:63}}: Brand is a fun AP Mid, you gotta learn how to use your abilities in the correct order for what you need, its not hard just takes practice.  

{{champion:90}}: Malzahar is my preferred AP Mid, he also requires a bit of practice but he is really easy to Farm with and his Voidlings are awesome.  

{{champion:103}}: Ahri is really fun to play, she is an AP Mid and she is really mobile which makes her pretty feakin cool.  

{{champion:69}}: Cassiopeia is a very easy AP Mid, hit either her Q or W then just spam the E button at them until they are out of range.  

{{champion:81}}: Ezreal is a really fun AD Marksmen and can be a really fun AP Mage, it depends on your preference.  

{{champion:43}}: Karma is more seen as a Support, but she is my second favorite AP Mid as her early game damage and easy to hit abilities make her very powerful.  

{{champion:30}}: Karthus is an AP Mid, i dont enjoy him all that much but his Ultimate is one of the most fun abilities in the game. His passive also allows you to still attack enemies even if you die.  

{{champion:161}}: Vel'Koz is pretty simple and fun, the goal is to hit them with abilities as often as possible and most of his abilities are fairly easy to hit.   

{{champion:51}}: Caitlyn is a AD Marksmen who is pretty easy to understand and use, her long range and damage make her a really strong pick against most opponents. She also happens to be the only ADC i actually play (I dont use Marksmen all that much.)  

{{champion:236}}: Lucian is my second favorite Marksmen, im not all that great with him but he is just loads of fun to play. His Q and Passive are my favorite things about him but his Ultimate is also incredibly fun.  
  
{{champion:15}}: Sivir is a good learning AD Marksmen as well as a strong champion. She is somewhat easy to understand and has very interesting mechanics.
 
These are just a few in addition to some of the others that were recommended here. I would like to add that you should try to buy Champions with IP and Skins with RP. If you want a really expensive Champion (the 6300 IP ones, maybe 4800 IP ones) then buying them with RP is fine, but i definitely wouldn't use RP on cheaper Champions.

Surprised that Quinn {{champion:133}} isn't listed.

She's pretty fun, not overpowered, and requires some thought and skill to play.

If you're just starting out, I would really take advantage of the free rotation (or ask if you can test out some champions on your fiancee's account in a custom game; I don't *think* you can get in trouble for this kind of 'account sharing' since you're not playing with/vs human players, but maybe you should double check); play every single champion you haven't played before, and as you get better at the game and start to learn more, play them again. If you're nervous about playing vs real people, you can always just play vs bots or even just load them into a custom game to try them out for a few levels and get a sense of how they work. You might run into some champions you don't like, and that's fine; playing different champions also gives you insight on how those champions work and how to play against them. Overall my suggestion would be to try every champion you can or seem interested in, even if you only go into a custom game and test out their abilities for 5 minutes before figuring out you don't like them.

RiotNurseFlan has some great suggestions for longer ranged mages (I would also add Xerath, Malzahar, and Vel'Koz to the list), but I would suggest you stay closer to Lux, Ziggs, Malzahar, or Vel'Koz (maybe Xerath too; in terms of just controlling him as a character he isn't too bad, but he can be tricky in the absolute highest levels of play), as Zyra and Syndra can be a bit more complicated.

You can also try Morgana; she and Annie are pretty easy to pick up and are my go-to mages at the moment (I'm really buckling down and focusing on my fundamentals, so I'm choosing very simple champions to play). Ryze and Veigar are also pretty straightforward to pick up, though they're in the process of being changed by Riot so I would wait a few patches to really start picking them up. Heimerdinger is also an option, he creates his own turrets so you can stick close to them, lol.

For ADCs, Jinx is a great champion, fairly straightforward to pick up, and has great range and damage. Caitlyn, Varus, and Ashe are also good champions to learn ADC and have among the longer ranges in the game.

Assassins are pretty complicated, and even if you're ranged you usually have to learn how to get in the middle of a fight. I feel like Talon and Akali are among the easier assassins to pick up and play, though, similar to Veigar and Ryze, Akali is kind of in a weird spot I think since Riot is still figuring out how they want to change her.

Since you're only level 7, I would recommend you just have fun with the game, I don't think there's a real urgent need for you to start running drills in custom games like I'm doing just yet. Unless you have ridiculous amounts of IP/RP to burn on champions (also would recommend you use IP to buy champions unless you don't have the time to grind up IP to buy them; in which case *I believe* the starter bundles Riot offers are actually more efficient in terms of RP, though you might want to double check on that. Also note that you can get Alistar, Tristana, and Garen for free by following their Youtube, Facebook, and Twitter, if you haven't already done so), I would recommend you try a champion out on free rotation or on a friend's account (again, don't think you'll get in trouble if it's just in a custom, but I might double check if I were you) before you buy them; I've made a few purchases I ended up regretting, and you only get 3 refund credits per account for life. Best of luck!

You got some advice, I'll add more.

First, don't worry about jungling until you are level 10 and get use the Smite summoner spell.  Without it jungling would be very unfun.

No for mid, you got some good advice, but I'll add my thoughts.
{{champion:103}} Ahri - very popular recently,  She's not really an assassin, but can be very powerful.  She's a bit tricky to learn due to her dash abilities, but will never be a terrible choice.

{{champion:268}} Azir - he was very good until a recent patch took away some of his damage.  He can play relatively safe, but he's a bit tricky as he summons sand soldiers to fight for him.  I've played with a good one and he was impressive.

{{champion:7}} Leblance - Mage/Assassin.  She's one of the champions many people say the hate to play against, but that's because if she gets a few kills she tends to steamroll the enemy team.  I can't say much more as I've never played her, but I've seen some good ones.

{{champion:99}} {{champion:25}} Lux and Morgana - Two very good mages that I put here together because in some ways they are very similar.  Lux has a better ultimate ability in my opinion and is considered the more natural midlane mage.  Morgana however is great at "farming" for CS and can also play as support thanks to having the ability to stun an enemy champ.  

{{champion:76}} {{champion:61}} {{champion:69}} {{champion:134}}  - These are all good champs.  However, I do not recommend them for new players.  Nidalee has 2 forms (human/cougar) and can be difficult to pickup.  Syndra is another hard to play champ as she requires that you pay attention to the number of dark spheres in play.  Cassiopeia powers up by poisoning the enemy champs, but is also not very mobile and is extremely mana-hungry.  Orianna is another one where you have an item you manipulate with your abilities.  She's fairly safe during the laning phase, but it can be difficult to direct her toy properly.

{{champion:115}}  Ziggs - the mad bomber who reminds me of Crazy Harry from the Muppets.  He's fun to have on your team, but is another mana hungry and squishy champion.

{{champion:101}} {{champion:161}}  - Xerath and Vel'Koz - good solid champs.  Not amazing, but not too difficult to learn to play.

{{champion:45}} Veigar - a recent change to his E ability has a lot of people upset as it made it much more difficult for him to stun enemy champs, but he's still a mage who can do a lot of damage to an enemy team.  But he's also often a primary target for the enemy team to kill.

{{champion:143}} Zyra - I play her as support.  She doesn't really have the ability to put out enough damage to excel in the midlane.  I don't recommend her as a first choice.

--
Also I see you worry about stealing kills or failing as support.  That mostly depends on teammates.  Most good ADCs aren't going to complain if you end up getting a finishing shot occasionally, especially if you keep them alive.  Any many of the better ranges supports are all about poking the other teams champs while the ADC tries to kill minions, so it can be fun.  It can also be boring if your ADC is going to hug the turret.  I still recommend it as a way to learn more about how an ADC works, as you can watch one.

--

Finally, although there are a lot of mages that go mid there are also melee assassins like Zed and Katarina.  They usually will win that 1v1 unless you have practiced.  Don't get too down on yourself if it does happen.  Those two champs need to "snowball" to be effective late game so people play them very aggressively in order to try to get kills.

I'm an ugly(acnes T_T) little girl and I don't have a rank(muh toxicity), but you can add me if you want :) I mainly play jungler/support/AP mage mid.

Some supports' job is also poking from a distance {{champion:43}} {{champion:37}}{{champion:267}} 
For AP mids, the current meta favors {{champion:69}}(kinda hard but rewarding) {{champion:7}}(this is hard too) {{champion:101}} {{champion:161}} {{champion:76}} (those 3 require skillshot presence)
For ADCs, the beginner's choices are {{champion:22}} {{champion:51}} {{champion:21}} *I suck at this role, those ppl I listed are community's favourites*

**All assasins are melee except LeBlanc and Nidalee**

Also, you can play some mages at toplane {{champion:117}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:50}} Their job is the same as other mages at midlane.

For supports, I steal kills a lot :D There's no problem. And you can press "S" to prevent yourself from autoattacking(and stealing farms)

If you like High Damage champs, learning to play an assassin mid would really fit your play style. The problem is most assassins are Close range though and there are only a few ranged. But here are some ranged  assassins and ap mids that i think would fit your play style

{{champion:101}} Xerath (Mage Mid)  Extremely long range You can easily poke anyone from under turret with this guy.

{{champion:161}} Vel'Koz (Mage Mid) Vel is Kindof Like Xerath Except slightly shorter range you can poke easy with him and your ult melts everyone.

{{champion:112}} Victor (Mage Mid) Victor is my personal Favorite burst Mage his spells deal SO much damage and he scales well into late game 

{{champion:7}} LeBlanc (AP Assassin Mid) Here is a ranged assassin that I think you'll like she has Rediculous burst and can easily get out of stiky situations with her W. The only bad thing is she is kindof hard to play.

{{champion:76}} Nidalee (AP Assassin Mid) Nidalee is a pretty good assassin mid, all you have to do is Land the Spears, and rush in with Cougar form Her Cougar Form is Melee Though I think you will enjoy her If you learn her.

Hope this helped and don't forget to have fun playing on the rift ;)

I recently picked up Ahri and would probably add her as a recommended champion to possibly try out. Sure two of her skills are skillshots, but if you land a charm you're almost guaranteed damage if you follow it up with a Q. I was always a top, support, or adc player but I switched to mid and fell in love with how much fun Ahri is. She's pretty safe from a distance too. Just never use your ult for all ins in you're not confident and instead use them for escapes. The speed buff on your Q really helps in lane as well to avoid ganks as long as you're not too far up.
